item.title: Session 1
item.description: Course Overview & Introduction to the Data Science Welcome to Technology Fundamentals for Business Analytics. We are going to familiarize you with all phases of the data science lifecycle and a wide variety of the technologies used. Before Class Sign up for Slack here. Create a Github account. Download the Slack app for your desktop and phone. Download the Github Desktop app. Download Anaconda with Python 3.7. Sign up for Google Colab I prefer to use Slack for class.

item.title: Assignment 2
item.description: Assignment: Topic Link Assignment 2 Grading: Grading will be done via LMS. Please upload a PDF of the completed assignment.

item.title: Contact Info
item.description: Jason Kuruzovich (Instructor) Slack (preferred) Email: kuruzj - at - rpi.edu Office Location: Pittsburgh 4108 (Located in the Severino Center) Phone: 518-698-9910 Lianlian (Dorothy) Jiang (Teaching Assistant) Slack (preferred) Email: Jiangl4 - at - rpi.edu Office Location: 2226 Pittsburgh Ask technical questions related to to class to an appropriate slack channel (#homework/#lab). This will ensure that everyone can jump in and help. I’d prefer that you address other messages to me also through Slack (rather than email).

item.title: Git/GitHub
item.description: Git and Github Git is a version control system use to track changes to code, and when combined with Github it is an extremely powerful way to collaborate. (1) Install the git command line tool. There are a lot of options but you should be able to just utilize the defaults. (2) Create an account on github.com. (3) Install Github desktop if using OSX or Windows. Click here for download instructions for Github Desktop.

item.title: Online Classes
item.description: Data Camp As part of this class you get a free subscription to Data Camp. I can’t post it here but will provide via email. Fast-AI Deep learning class. Siraj Rival Extremely entertaining YouTube star covers a wide variety of things in machine learning.

item.title: Session 2
item.description: Session 2 Class Objective: The goal will be to you how to work in Jupyter Notebooks and with Git/Github. Readings (To be done before class): Additional Suggested Reading: Chapter 1 from Doing Data Science and Chapter 1 from Data Science for Business (Both available through library). Command Line Cheat Sheet Assignment Process Running Jupyter locally In Class Activities: Running code, Data and Packages Topic Link Python Overview Basic Data Structures Numpy Pandas Lab Homework 1

item.title: Assignment 3
item.description: Assignment: Topic Link Assignment 3 Grading: Grading will be done via LMS. Please upload a PDF of the completed assignment.

item.title: Session 3
item.description: Data Fundamentals and Introduction to Python Class Objective: The goal of this class is to introduce you to some of the foundational aspects of data generation as well as provide an introduction to programming with Python. Readings (To be done before class): Chapters 1-3 from Principles of Data Wrangling Get started with HM1, LAB1 In Class Activities: See Dropbox for presentation.

item.title: Assignment 4
item.description: Assignment You can copy and paste this and your visualizations into a word document. This assignment should be turned into the LMS as a PDF. Getting Started with Tableau Desktop. For this lab we will begin the process of learning visualization through the See Click Fix Kaggle Project. Go ahead and download the train file from Github or from the Dropbox/Kaggle folder. The first part of any data visualization project is data understanding.

item.title: Office/Lab Hours
item.description: Jason Kuruzovich Office/Lab Hours: Monday 3:00 - 5:00 and by appointment Office/Lab Location: I’ll hold office hours in the SA lounge or Severino Center, both in Pittsburgh for the majority of the time. Lianlian (Dorothy) Jiang (grader) Office/Lab Hours: Monday 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM by appointment Office/Lab Location: 2128 Pittsburgh. *Please see Dorothy primarily for issues related to grading. She is traveling a good bit this semester on job market so please make an appointment to confirm she is in the building.

item.title: Session 4
item.description: Data Fundamentals and Introduction to Python Class Objective: The goal of this class is to introduce you to some basic data structures using Python. Readings (To be done before class): Chapter 1 Introduction to Machine Learning with Python In Class Activities: See the Tech Fundamentals class materials repository. Be sure to download updates by using the sync or pull buttons on GitHub Desktop. Topic Link Conditionals-Loops Functions Null Values Groupby Kaggle Baseline Assignment 2

item.description: Assignment: Topic Link HM5A Visualization & Screen Scraping HM5B Intro Modeling

item.title: Session 5
item.description: Data Fundamentals and Introduction to Python (continued) Class Objective: The goal of this class is to continue to extend our knowledge of some basic python data structures and syntax. We will also more generally discuss data merging, cleaning, filtering, and aggregation. Readings (To be done before class): Chapter 1 Introduction to Machine Learning with Python

item.description: Pro Git Codeschool Git Class Learning about Branches Explaining Git with D3 Understanding the Git Flow

item.title: Grading
item.description: Component Weight Homeworks and Labs 30% Projects (Multi-week Homeworks) 30% Midterm (7th Class) 20% Final Exam 20%

item.title: Session 6
item.description: Data Fundamentals and Introduction to Python (continued) Class Objective: The goal of this class is to continue to extend our knowledge of some basic python data structures and syntax. We will also more generally discuss data merging, cleaning, filtering, and aggregation. Readings (To be done before class): Pandas Intro to Data Structures (series and dataframe only) In Class Activities: See Dropbox for Presentations Topic Link Twitter Web Mining Visualizations - Seaborn Strings - Regular Expressions Feature Dummies Assignment 3

item.title: Assignment 7
item.description: Assignment: This should be completed using Apache Spark Community Addition. Create a DataBricks Community Edition Account Login to Community Edition Account 03-spark-questions.ipynb (Due 4⁄4 11:59 PM) https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rpi-techfundamentals/spring2019-materials/master/10-big-data/03-spark-questions.ipynb

item.title: Session 7
item.description: Data Fundamentals and Introduction to Python (continued) Class Objective: The goal of this class is to continue to extend our knowledge of accessing data via APIs and begin to understand feature creation. Readings (To be done before class): Feature engineering in Titanic Chapter 2 Data Science for Business Review the Twitter Documentation In Class Activities: See Dropbox.

item.title: Midterm Review
item.description: Midterm The goal for the midterm is to spend some time reviewing some of the basic processes that we have utilized thus far. Basic concepts, syntax, and processes which will be useful in data science projects. The midterm will consist of 2 sections. Part 1: Multiple Choice/Short answer The first section will be closed book/closed notes. You should understand conceptual issues with the class, technologies, packages, CRISP model, etc. If given a piece of code, you should be able to interpret what it does.

item.title: Project draft
item.description: Assignment: Project Draft (Sections 1-3) Due 03/21 11:59 PM See the project details for more information.

item.title: Python
item.description: Introduction to Machine Learning with Python by Andreas C. Müller; Sarah Guido (Available through library) Think Stats Probability and Statistics for Programmers in Python (free download) Conda Python + Numpy Tutorial Python Docs Tutorial Python: Conda Python + Numpy Tutorial Python Docs Tutorial Plotting: matplotlib.pyplot tutorial: This short tutorial provides an overview of the basic plotting utilities we will be using.

item.title: Session 8
item.description: Intro to Visualization Class Objective: The goal of this class is to introduce principles of visualization and to show examples from a variety of different tools and packages useful for developing visualizations. Assignment (To be done before class): Install Tableau Free for university students. Tableau - Data analytics for university students guide Designing Great Visualizations Tableau getting Started Ted Talk In Class Activities: Classic Examples Nightingale’s ‘Coxcombs’ Napolean’s March Explaining Complex Data Social Media in one Live Wind Map 538 Trump vs Clinton 1 Sentiment Making a Point/Points Military Spending Mountains Out of Molehills Billion Dollar O’Gram Uncovering Patterns The Dude Map

item.title: Assignment 8
item.description: Assignment: This should be completed using Apache Spark Community Addition. Create a DataBricks Community Edition Account Login to Community Edition Account 03-spark-questions.ipynb (Due 4⁄4 11:59 PM) https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rpi-techfundamentals/spring2019-materials/master/10-big-data/03-spark-questions.ipynb

item.title: Session 9
item.description: Introduction to Modeling Class Objective: The goal of this class is to expose you more to the introduction of the analysis process. Readings (To be done before class): (1) Cross Validation (2) The 10 Algorithms Machine Learning Engineers Need to Know. (3) 15 Algorithms Machine Learning Engineers Must Need to Know (4) A Tour of Machine Learning Algorithms (5) An Introduction to Machine Learning with Python - Chapter 2-3

item.title: All Notebooks
item.description: Topic Link What is Jupyter? Notebook Basics Running Code Markdown More on Colab Python Overview Basic Data Structures Numpy Pandas Lab Homework 1 Conditionals-Loops Functions Null Values Groupby Kaggle Baseline Assignment 2 Twitter Web Mining Visualizations - Seaborn Strings - Regular Expressions Feature Dummies Assignment 3 The Simplest Neural Network with Numpy Train Test Split Introduction to Logistic Regression K Nearest Neighbor ROC Support Vector Machines Visualization & Screen Scraping Homework Intro Modeling Homework Matrix Regression Regression Basics Ridge and Lasso Regression Principal Component Analysis Titanic Feature Creation Intro to Corpus Scikit Learn Text What’s Cooking Bag of Popcorn Sentiment Time Series Intro Forcasting Rossman Intro to Map Reduce Run on DataBricks: https://raw.

item.title: Anaconda
item.description: Step 2: Install and Configure Anaconda We will be using Anaconda to provide a Jupyter environment for both R and Python. Follow the following instructions to install Anaconda from Continuum Analytics. OSX Windows Linux Once you have the Anaconda Distribution, follow below for advanced configuration. OSX Follow the online instructions to install the Anaconda Distribution with Python 3.6 Follow below for advanced configuration. Windows Windows may often have issues associated with installation if you have had previous versions of Anaconda installed.

item.title: Assignment 9
item.description: Assignment: Please upload your final notebook. All work should be yours. This is an individual assignment. Use the excel notebooks in this directory. https://www.dropbox.com/sh/znfag1qic4djyod/AADrfv3E2e705r8nruDlQXTka?dl=0

item.description: Introduction to Statistical Learning (Free online PDF) R for Data Science (available online) Berkeley R Bootcamp

item.title: Session 10
item.description: Introduction to Modeling Class Objective: The goal of this class is to expose you more to the introduction of the analysis process. Readings (To be done before class): (1) Cross Validation (2) The 10 Algorithms Machine Learning Engineers Need to Know. (3) 15 Algorithms Machine Learning Engineers Must Need to Know (4) A Tour of Machine Learning Algorithms (5) An Introduction to Machine Learning with Python - Chapter 2-3

item.title: Session 11
item.description: Data Fundamentals and Introduction to Python (continued) Introduction to R Class Objective: The goal of this class is to get you familiar to using R. While we will be Jupyter notebooks, we will also examine using RStudio. Now that you have already started with Python, many of the concepts will map. Readings (To be done before class): R for Data Science Chapters 1-3 Prior to class, please create an account on RStudio Cloud.

item.title: Project
item.description: Project Selection This is a summary from the in class exercise. Project Exercise This is an individual project, but like the homework you can ask for advice from others directly and in the Slack Channel. Project Objective The goal is to develop an understanding of how individuals approach data science projects, seeing the entire process from exploratory data analysis to modeling and evaluation. If you feel there is another Kaggle contest you would like to do, just ask in the #projects slack channel.

item.title: Session 12
item.description: R Class Objective: The goal of this class is to get you familiar to using R. While we will be Jupyter notebooks, we will also examine using RStudio. Now that you have already started with Python, many of the concepts will map. Readings (To be done before class): (1) Introduction (2) Workflow Basics (3) From Data Structures including Vectors, Attributes, Matrices, arrays, and Data frames. (4) Install RStudio via the Anaconda Navigator.

item.title: Session 13
item.description: Introduction to Modeling Class Objective: The goal of this class is to expose you more to the introduction of the analysis process. Readings (To be done before class): (1) Cross Validation (2) The 10 Algorithms Machine Learning Engineers Need to Know. (3) 15 Algorithms Machine Learning Engineers Must Need to Know (4) A Tour of Machine Learning Algorithms (5) An Introduction to Machine Learning with Python - Chapter 2-3

item.description: Midterm The goal for the midterm is to spend some time reviewing some of the basic processes that we have utilized thus far. Basic concepts, syntax, and processes which will be useful in data science projects.

item.title: Session 15
item.description: Project Work Day Class Objective: The goal of this is to do some active work on the project. Please fill out this form on the Kaggle Challenge you Selected. https://goo.gl/forms/G7RlD5UGseMbPAlN2 Topic Link Ridge and Lasso Regression PCA

item.title: Session 16
item.description: Text Mining and Unstructured Data Class Objective: The goal of this class is to investigate basic concepts surrounding text mining. Readings (To be done before class): The Seven Practice Areas of Text Mining The Amazing Power of Word Vectors Bag of Words Tutorial Word Vectors In Classes Topic Link Titanic Feature Creation Intro to Corpus Scikit Learn Text What’s Cooking Bag of Popcorn Sentiment

item.title: Session 17
item.description: Text Mining and Unstructured Data Class Objective: The goal of this class is to investigate basic concepts surrounding text mining. Readings (To be done before class): The Seven Practice Areas of Text Mining The Amazing Power of Word Vectors Bag of Words Tutorial Word Vectors In Classes Topic Link Titanic Feature Creation Intro to Corpus Scikit Learn Text What’s Cooking Bag of Popcorn Sentiment

item.title: Session 18
item.description: Introduction to Time Series Analysis Class Objective: This will include more discussion of models, with more details and types. Specifically, we will go over tree models and regression models. Readings (To be done before class): (1) Introduction to Time Series (2) 7 Ways Time Series Forecasting Differs from Machine Learning (3) Aggregation Techniques and Cryptocurrencies In Class Topic Link Time Series Intro Forcasting Rossman

item.title: Session 19
item.description: Introduction to Big Data Class Objective: The goal here is to provide an overview of how data processes can be scaled with Spark. Readings (To be done before class): Create a DataBricks Community Edition Account Gentle Introduction To Spark - Download ebook Review the Hadoop Ecosystem In Class Exercises On the DataBricks Platform you should execute both the Introduction to Apache Spark on Databricks and the Databricks for Data Scientists.

item.title: Books
item.description: O’Reilly Media titles can be accessed through the RPI library subscription. If there is a specific title you would like access to that isn’t listed, the library can adjust the list. Data Science & Business Data Science for Business Doing Data Science Git Pro Git PYTHON Introduction to Machine Learning with Python Data Science Handbook Data Science from Scratch R Introduction to Statistical Learning (Free online PDF) R for Data Science (available online)

item.title: Data 8 @ Rensselaer
item.description: Data literacy is a foundational component of a modern technical and scientific education. Critical to creating data literate graduates. For the Data 8 class, the University of California at Berkley has developed an open curriculum and extensive teaching infrastructure (online textbook, auto-grader, Jupyter-based cloud computing infrastructure for data science) created the worlds largest data science class. This proposal suggests creating an instance of the Data 8 class @ Rensselaer. All materials for the Data 8 course have been released under a compatible Creative Commons license.

item.title: Session 20
item.description: Introduction to Big Data Class Objective: The goal here is to provide an overview of how data processes can be scaled with Spark. Readings (To be done before class): Create a DataBricks Community Edition Account Gentle Introduction To Spark - Download ebook Review the Hadoop Ecosystem In Class Exercises On the DataBricks Platform you should execute both the Introduction to Apache Spark on Databricks and the Databricks for Data Scientists.

item.title: Winter Break Projects
item.description: It’s great to have stories as an outcome of the program. Why not work on something over the break that will create one? Here is a list of a few projects where you could get involved. Autograding with TravisCI. As part of this class we incorporate tests as a way to see that the the student has completed the assignment. However, there is a risk that students could “fake the tests” and as a result not do the work.

item.title: Session 21
item.description: Introduction to Deep Learning Class Objective: The goal here is to provide an overview of how data processes can be scaled with Spark. Readings (To be done before class): You can do Deep Learning Neural Networks - The Math of Intelligence #4 Play Around with this Hands-On Machine Learning Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow by Aurélien Géron (Skim Chapters 9-11) In Class Exercises Deep learning exercises on Dropbox.

Autonomous RC Racing @Rensselaer” description = “” weight = 20 +++ Data literacy is a foundational component of a modern technical and scientific education. Critical to creating data literate graduates. For the Data 8 class, the University of California at Berkley has developed an open [curriculum]() and extensive teaching infrastructure (online textbook, auto-grader, Jupyter-based cloud computing infrastructure for data science) created the worlds largest data science class. This proposal suggests creating an instance of the Data 8 class @ Rensselaer.
